results.title: Butterflies
results.brief_description: This film studies the life history of the cabbage butterfly and the swallow-tail butterfly, showing their habits and characteristics, and their role in nature: that of aiding cross-fertilization of flowers. The cabbage butterfly’s destructiveness and its control by a natural enemy is shown.

results.title: But first - this message
results.creator_credit: Yale Marc, Jim Herzig and Action for Children's Television
results.brief_description: Presents an analysis of commercial television programs for children, with excerpts from shows and commercials. Includes comments from professionals working with children and reactions from children.

results.title: A Busy sort of bloke: Harold Hughan
results.creator_credit: Lindsay Frazer, Gillian Armstrong, Australia Council and Crafts Council of Australia
results.brief_description: The simplicity and charm of the man and his work are portrayed in this film, which shows Harold Hughan at home and at work. He is seen making a platter, and he discusses the objective of his pieces made with clay. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: The Busy harbour
results.brief_description: Ted and Maria visit a tugboat captain in the busy harbour. He explains some of the many activities going on in the harbour; fishing boats unloading, tugboats pulling barges, cargo ships, a lighthouse and buoy. They take a ride on the captain’s tugboat.

results.title: Busy hands
results.creator_credit: A Bhaskarrao, M. Bhavnani and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: This film shows villagers as they attend cottage industries classes held in their communities in which families learn weaving, rope making, tailoring, tanning and leather work, pottery and other useful trades. NB: Print unable to be screened due to shrinkage.

results.title: Buster Keaton rides again
results.creator_credit: John Spotton, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In this film Buster Keaton rides across Canada on a railway scooter and, between times, rests in a specially appointed passenger coach where he and Mrs Keaton lived during their Canadian film assignment. This film is about how Buster Keaton made a Canadian travel film, “The Railrodder”. In this informal study the comedian regales the film crew with anecdotes of a lifetime in show business. Excerpts from his silent slapstick films are shown. Awards: Seven, including Venice; New York; Melbourne; Milan. Commentary by Donald Brittain.

results.title: Bushy, the squirrel
results.brief_description: Designed for use in primary classes. Eight-year-old Steve discovers a squirrel frightening away the birds in his yard. He and his father find the squirrel’s home in a tree in the woods. Making trips to the woods to see Bushy, they discover other forest animals. With patience and perseverance Steve teaches the squirrel to eat from his hand.

results.title: Bushtrak
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Ampol Petroleum Ltd and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the layout of an obstacle track designed to test physical prowess. Obstacles include climbing nets, climbing bars and swinging ropes. Commentary by Paul Ricketts.

results.title: The Bushman goes home
results.creator_credit: Eric Bedford and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A cattle station owner makes the long journey from his vast cattle station on the Gulf of Carpentaria to visit Melbourne and the cattle saleyards. He then flies back via the cattle fattening plains of New South Wales. Narrated by Nigel Lovell.

results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Illustrates the danger of bushfires and describes how bodies such as the Volunteer Bushfire Brigade and the Forestry Firefighting gangs are organised to prevent and fight bushfires.
